meanings.definition: An exclamation or oath, especially one that is profane or obscene.
meanings.sent2: She shouted an expletive when she dropped the plate.
meanings.sent3: After stubbing his toe, he let out an expletive that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The expletive he muttered under his breath showed his frustration.
meanings.sent5: The loud expletive echoed through the room, causing everyone to turn and look.

meanings.definition: A word or phrase used to fill out a sentence or line of verse.
meanings.sent1: The writer added an expletive to make the sentence flow better.
meanings.sent2: In poetry, an expletive can enhance the rhythm of the verse.
meanings.sent3: The expletive in the song lyrics added a touch of playfulness.
meanings.sent4: She used an expletive to emphasize her point in the argument.
meanings.sent5: The expletive at the end of the sentence gave it a satisfying conclusion.
